item.title: London Underground Dot Matrix Typeface
item.description: - The London Underground Dot Matrix Typeface is a set of fonts that replicate the typefaces used on the arrival boards and announcement boards of the London Underground transportation system.

item.title: Update: U+237C ⍼ &Angzarr;
item.description: - The post investigates the origin and history of the symbol U+237C ⍼ RIGHT ANGLE WITH DOWNWARDS ZIGZAG ARROW in the Unicode standard.

item.title: Bullshit Jobs (2018)
item.description: - Bullshit jobs are pointless and unnecessary positions that exist in both the public and private sectors, causing frustration among employees and undermining the true purpose of organizations.

item.title: GB Studio: Drag & drop retro game creator for GameBoy
item.description: - GB Studio is a user-friendly drag and drop game creator that allows you to make retro games for the GameBoy handheld video game system.

item.title: I don't need your query language
item.description: - The author expresses their frustration with the emergence of new query languages in the industry and argues that using SQL as a common ground language for general-purpose databases is more practical and efficient.

item.title: The Secret Sauce behind 100K context window in LLMs: all tricks in one place
item.description: - The post discusses techniques to speed up training and inference of Large Language Models (LLMs) to use a context window of up to 100K input tokens, which is significantly larger than previous models.

item.title: People can be convinced they committed a crime that never happened (2015)
item.description: - Research shows that innocent individuals can be convinced, through proper questioning techniques, that they have committed a crime that never actually happened.

item.title: Ask HN: Why does Apple refuse to add window snapping to macOS?
item.description: - The post discusses why Apple has not added a feature called "window snapping" to its macOS operating system.

item.title: Review of Hetzner ARM64 servers & experience of WebP cloud services on them
item.description: - The performance review of Hetzner's ARM64 servers shows that they perform very well, with the CAX21 machine only being 8% slower than the CPX21 machine in WebP conversion speed.

item.title: Merging bcachefs
item.description: - The bcachefs filesystem, aimed at providing high performance and reliability, is getting closer to being merged into the mainline Linux kernel.
